meanings.definition: To scream louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the concert, Sarah tried to outscream her friend to be heard.
meanings.sent2: The little girl managed to outscream her brother when they played outside.
meanings.sent3: The competition was to see who could outscream the other in a fun game.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement outscreamed all the other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outscreamed the howling wind with its booming noise.

meanings.sent1: The singer outscreamed all the other performers at the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The angry cat outscreamed the barking dog in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The siblings tried to outscream each other in a playful shouting match.
meanings.sent4: His frustration outscreamed any other emotion he was feeling.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outscreamed the cheers of the crowd with their loud explosions.
